thread.title: Big Brothers Big Sisters of Macomb celebrates 25 years
thread.title_full: Big Brothers Big Sisters of Macomb celebrates 25 years

author: KHQA News Desk
title: Big Brothers Big Sisters of Macomb celebrates 25 years
text:
Macomb, Illinois (KHQA) â€” It's been 25 years since the Big Brothers Big Sisters in Macomb opened it's doors.
In that time the organization has mentored countless young children.
On Wednesday, they celebrated that milestone.
Dozens showed up to celebrate all the work the organization has done, and the people that made it possible.
Awards were given to special volunteers and organizations that have helped BBBS over these 25 years.
Big Brother Big Sisters pairs kids up with adults to act as mentors.
They help them with anything from career advice to mental health and interpersonal relationship advice.
Overall, kids who participate in the program have better outcomes in life.
"Our littles see an increase in academics, the grades go up, they are less likely to be involved in illegal drugs, and addiction, also our littles are more likely to attend a higher education, or career, after being mentored by an adult." Stated Sarah Baca, the Program Director for the BBBS of McDonough and Warren county.
If you are interested in becoming involved with Big Brothers Big Sisters, you can find all the relevant information to do so here.
